page.title: 04Wendover Carnival.
page.content: Wendover Carnival is one of the few events which inspires a feeling of community spirit in the village. It has been held annually in the Pebble Brook School grounds since 1969. It started as a fund-raising event to finance the building of the open air swimming pool in Wendover, but now it is used to fund various village projects and local charities have stalls there. Each year the Carnival is preceded by the increasingly popular Coombe Hill Race, which is as well supported as the actual Carnival. Annual carnival attractions include a highly esteemed dog show, an art show, a funfair, a Fancy Dress Competition and The Miss Wendover Beauty Contest. Past memorable events have included Parachute Jumps, Hot Air Balloons, Morris Men and Gymnastic displays by Apprentices'at RAF Halton.
